subject: Re: Voice to Print Software Results
author: itcdeadpeople
full_text:
Wow, Aaron.  That's awesome info.  Thanks for taking the time to do that.  Did you, by 
chance, then compare the EVP Maker recording to see if you heard any meaningful 
phrases, or if the software was interpreting it pretty close to what you are hearing?

Very interesting!

Margaret

--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "kolrone" <a.cronk@...> wrote:
>
> Alright, I went ahead and practiced some with the Naturally Speaking
> Software. You have to go through training before anything is
> recognized and you have to read passages on screen. So I went ahead
> and started reading everything in a monotone type voice. I tried to
> imitate the allophone file from EVPMaker as close as possible. "Or"
> showed up many times, and at one point it made me laugh because it
> showed up as "or you are a boy toy." Much of this was when I left the
> room and let EVPMaker play into the mic. What was interesting was that
> I left the room because I was on the phone with my friend that is a
> girl. But I don't think the boy toy remark really applied to me. lol.
> Here are the results (Sorry it is so much and not formatted very well,
> it's just a quick copy and paste job):
